about.title: About me
about.text: Passionate about creating interactive and aesthetic websites, I followed training as a web integrator at Openclassrooms in 2023/2024, focusing on HTML, CSS and JavaScript. My ambition is to transform visual concepts into user experiences that are both engaging and functional.
about.text1: Always looking for new opportunities to learn and progress, I invest myself in web development with the constant objective of improving my skills, exploring new technologies and participating in innovative projects that push the digital design boundaries.

projects.title: Kasa
projects.description: Creation of a real estate rental web application with React.
projects.additionalInfo: Kasa is the first React project that I carried out as part of my web integrator training.
projects.objectives: From the specifications provided, I created this real estate rental application. Using the React and React Router libraries allowed me to create a dynamic and interactive user interface, and Sass made it easier to manage styles. Housing data is imported from a provided Json file for better performance and ease of updating.

projects.title: Nina Carducci
projects.description: SEO optimization of a photographer's website.
projects.additionalInfo: Improved site performance, accessibility and best practices for better SEO.
projects.objectives: The audits carried out allowed me to identify and optimize the application code. By reducing the weight of images, minifying CSS files and integrating SEO tags, I was able to significantly improve the site's performance. Finally, I produced a report for the client, explaining the modifications made and their impacts on the application.

projects.title: Argent Bank
projects.description: Creating a secure user interface for a banking application with React and Redux.
projects.additionalInfo: Argent Bank is a project carried out as part of my web integrator training at OpenClassrooms.
projects.objectives: Implementation of a user interface with a secure authentication system, and creation of a document via Swagger, describing the API routes on the back-end side, which would allow the user to carry out certain personal transactions.
